intro: Scopolia scopolia, commonly known as the European white helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically growing in moist, shaded woodlands. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, white to pale green flowers with a distinctive, spurred lip. Its botanical characteristics include a rhizomatous root system and a preference for calcareous soils. Scopolia scopolia is known for its medicinal properties, though its use is limited due to the toxicity of some of its compounds.
